publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3212 Shiona Baird: Eco Prize for Creativity—That the Parliament congratulates Dundee University-based artists, Dalziel and Scullion, on winning the Eco Prize for Creativity 2005; welcomes the new annual award established by the Eco Trust, Friends of the Earth Scotland and Scotland’s Centre for Architecture, Design and the City at The Lighthouse for contributing to a much-needed informed public debate on the environment in Scotland, and recognises the vital role that visual art has to play in stimulating that debate.Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Patrick Harvie*, Mark Ballard*, Robin Harper*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Chris Ballance*, Shona Robison*
S2M-3212 Eco Prize for Creativity (lodged on 31 August 2005) Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-3212 Eco Prize for Creativity (lodged on 31 August 2005) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3212 Eco Prize for Creativity (lodged on 31 August 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3212 Eco Prize for Creativity (lodged on 31 August 2005) Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*
